emulator.core.cpu

Interface BitShift


  • public interface BitShift
    Shifts/Rotates register or byte of memory.
    Author:
    Daniel Simpkins

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void rotate(CPU cpu, byte instruction, boolean isPrefix)
      Parses instruction and rotates/shifts register or memory.
      static void rotateLeft(Register register, Flags flags, boolean highLow, boolean useCarry, boolean setZero)
      Rotates a register or byte from memory one bit to the left.
      static void rotateRight(Register register, Flags flags, boolean highLow, boolean useCarry, boolean setZero)
      Rotates a register or byte from memory one bit to the right.

    • Method Detail

      • rotate

        static void rotate(CPU cpu,
                   byte instruction,
                   boolean isPrefix)
        Parses instruction and rotates/shifts register or memory.
        Parameters:
        cpu - Reference to the CPU object.
        instruction - Instruction opcode.
        isPrefix - States whether the opcode is prefix or standard.

      • rotateLeft

        static void rotateLeft(Register register,
                       Flags flags,
                       boolean highLow,
                       boolean useCarry,
                       boolean setZero)
        Rotates a register or byte from memory one bit to the left.
        Parameters:
        register - Reference to the 16-bit register object to rotate.
        flags - Reference to the flags object to affect.
        highLow - True for high byte, false for low byte
        useCarry - Set if carry is to be stored into bit 0
        setZero - Set if the zero flag is to be set

      • rotateRight

        static void rotateRight(Register register,
                        Flags flags,
                        boolean highLow,
                        boolean useCarry,
                        boolean setZero)
        Rotates a register or byte from memory one bit to the right.
        Parameters:
        register - Reference to the 16-bit register object to rotate.
        flags - Reference to the flags object to affect.
        highLow - True for high byte, false for low byte.
        useCarry - Set if carry is to be stored into bit 0.
        setZero - Set if the zero flag is to be set.
